topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5416599163687237664a0000#post_5416599163687237664a0000
Well, Norse mythology is still alive... kinda.

But even what we know about it today is the stuff that was written down _after_ Christianity was spreading in the Nordic region. It's influences may not be very pronounced, but they're there- there are parallels between Baldr and Jesus for example, among others.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541659266368724852bb0000#post_541659266368724852bb0000
There are a few reasons for that, and also dude when was the last time you read the bible? That shit is nuts! You got Samson murdering a shit load of dudes with the jaw bone of an ass, David making a marriage proposal with the foreskins of an entire army and the entire Book of Revelations, which frankly makes me wonder if maybe St. John was on mushrooms at the time.

Then you've got the apocrypha, all the books that got cut because the counsel of elderly dudes who put together what we now know as the Bible thought they were too wacky for mass consumption.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
Does anybody know why large growing religions came somewhere in the middle of Asia? Or at least, from Asia? 
I mean, there's no religion like Christianity or Islam coming from Australia, America or even Africa. They're only spread there!

"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54165b9f6368723cb02f0100#post_54165b9f6368723cb02f0100
